Secrets behind Rajinikanth’s Annamalai | Suresh Krissna Interview | This Changed my Life
description:
Director Suresh Krissna, who is known for his four films with Rajinikanth (Annamalai, Veera, Baasha and Baba) and two with Kamal Haasan (Sathya and Aalavandan), is excited that his Annamalai, his first film with Rajinikanth, is re-releasing on December 12, 2025, coinciding with the Superstar’s birthday.

“Back in 1992, fans celebrated the film as if it was their own. The fact that many elements – including friendship, revenge, love and fights – were part of the cinematic package appealed to them. I hope they love it today too.”

In an exclusive with ‘The Hindu’, as part of ‘This Changed my Life’ podcast, the director talks about how Rajinikanth influenced an entire generation and how his films were lapped up.

Interview: Srinivasa Ramanujam
Video: S Shiva Raj
Edit: Johan Sathyadas

title: Michael Annett dies at 39: Cause of former NASCAR star’s death and family reaction

Annett, a respected figure, achieved a significant victory at Daytona in the 2019 Xfinity Series. His career, marked by perseverance and skill, saw him race for various teams since 2008. The cause of his death remains undisclosed, leaving the motorsport community in mourning.

Authorities have deployed significant security forces to maintain law and order, with the MLA proceeding with arrangements despite the court's directive.

title: Gurgaon hit-and-run: Businessman killed; 22-year-old unlicensed driver arrested
description: A 58-year-old cyclist was tragically killed in a hit-and-run on Akashneem Marg, Gurgaon. The driver, a 22-year-old unlicensed housekeeping staffer, borrowed a bouncer's car and struck the cyclist from behind before fleeing. CCTV footage aided police in identifying and arresting the driver, who now faces multiple charges.

title: Gujarat farmer distress: Where cotton clouds hang heavy
description: Following heavy rainfall in October and the subsequent drop in the price of cotton, six farmers have died by suicide in Gujarat. The Union government’s decision to allow duty-free cotton imports has only added to their woes. A.M. Jigeesh reports on how farmers in Gujarat’s cotton belt are calling for government intervention

title: Pan masala cess gets Lok Sabha nod in boost to defence priorities
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated the government aims to prevent UPA-era defence shortages by ensuring a steady revenue stream for modern warfare capabilities. A new cess on pan masala manufacturing units will fund national security and public health, addressing concerns about potential price drops and health impacts.

title: JDU politician stirs pot again, says many want Nitish’s son in politics
description: JDU's working president Sanjay Kumar Jha indicated that party members and supporters desire for Nishant Kumar, son of Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, to enter politics. Jha stated the decision rests with the 49-year-old engineer. Nishant, who has recently increased his public presence and praised his father's governance, declined to comment on the matter.

title: FIRs, tech hurdles, deadlines leave Noida BLOs gasping for breath
Ring missing? Mandhana's first post since wedding postponement - Watch
description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana broke her social media silence with a toothpaste ad post, sparking speculation due to her missing engagement ring. Her wedding to Palash Muchhal was indefinitely postponed due to family medical emergencies, with recent nazar emojis in bios addressing further rumours.  Mandhana is set to return to cricket soon.

title: 'He will decide India’s fate': Ex-India star picks X-factor for T20 World Cup
description: Irfan Pathan explains Rinku Singh's T20I squad exclusion, citing Hardik Pandya's return as the primary reason.  Pathan believes this squad is largely set for the 2026 T20 World Cup, emphasizing Hardik Pandya's pivotal role in India's global campaign and the need for clarity in pace and spin combinations.

title: Putin promises non-stop energy, PM says Russia ties like pole star
description: India and Russia reaffirmed their strong ties, signing over a dozen agreements to boost economic partnership to $100 billion by 2030. Both nations committed to uninterrupted fuel shipments and discussed civil nuclear cooperation. Discussions also covered defense, manpower mobility, and India's UN Security Council bid, with leaders expressing satisfaction with the summit's outcomes.

description: Gehry died on December 5 in his home in Santa Monica after a brief respiratory illness, said Meaghan Lloyd, chief of staff at Gehry Partners LLP

‘Exclusive rights over temple rituals’, TN defends defying HC order in SC
description: Tamil Nadu's DMK government sought an urgent Supreme Court hearing on its appeal against the Madras High Court's order allowing the 'Karthigai Deepam' lighting atop Thiruparankundram hills. The state claims exclusive rights over temple rituals, defying the HC's directives. The SC acknowledged the plea but offered no immediate assurance for an early listing.

description: “It should be ensured that the reform is rooted in dignity and justice, not stigma,”

description: Protests are being held by aspirants under the open merit category, demanding an increase in the current upper age limit from 32 to 37

description: Maharashtra Education department said it wants to collaborate with Educate Girls to adopt its AI-driven model and introduce open schools for adults in the State.

Fadnavis hails quota for orphans as ‘historic’; Congress seeks White Paper on Mahayuti’s first year in office

title: Delhi University law student stabbed to death in south Delhi's Sangam Vihar; 2 held
description: Irshad, a first-year LLB student at Delhi University's Campus Law Centre, had multiple stab injuries, the police said.

title: Russia makes first delivery of Nuclear-fuel for TN nuclear plant's 3rd unit
description: Undeterred by global pressures, Russia has commenced nuclear fuel deliveries for Kudankulam's third unit, reinforcing its commitment to uninterrupted energy cooperation with India. This marks the first VVER-1000 fuel shipment under a new contract, promising extended operational cycles and improved performance for India's growing nuclear power capacity.

title: Donald Trump signals return to Monroe Doctrine and questions Europe’s future ties
MCD budget: no new taxes, focus on sanitation, health
description: Will boost revenue collection, says Commissioner, notes that liabilities have swelled to ₹15,791.8 cr., nearly the budget’s size; plan for shelter in Dwarka to house aggressive dogs ready, adds top official

title: Fifa World Cup 2026 draw: Easy group for Argentina, ceremony overshadowed by peace prize for Trump from gleeing friend Infantino
India, Russia agree to boost efforts on joint climate action
description: India and Russia have pledged to boost joint efforts on climate action, aligning with global UN goals and the Paris Agreement. Both nations will collaborate on increasing climate finance and technology access for developing countries. They also agreed to intensify dialogue on carbon trading, low-carbon technologies, and sustainable finance, while continuing cooperation within G20, Brics, and SCO.

title: Prasar Bharati signs MoUs with Russian media organisations
description: The organisations include Joint Stock Company Gazprom-media Holding; National Media Group, BIG ASIA Media Group, ANO TV-Novosti, and TV BRICS

Cardi B’s wild twerk show at Stefon Diggs’ birthday leaves fans stunned
description: Cardi B's energetic twerk performance at Stefon Diggs' Miami birthday bash has set the internet ablaze. The rapper's celebratory dance, set to Metro Boomin's track, captured widespread attention, highlighting the couple's high-profile romance. This viral moment underscores the public's fascination with Cardi B's life, from her relationships to her public appearances, ensuring their continued presence in trending topics.

title: International tiger trafficker held by M.P. tiger strike force from Sikkim
description: Yangchen Lachungpa (44), wanted under an INTERPOL Red Notice and involved in alleged trafficking of tiger body parts, was held from Lachung in North Sikkim on December 2, based on intelligence inputs and coordinated ground action

The incident, captured in viral videos, sparked online outrage and prompted legal action.

description: Amidst US sanctions on Russian oil majors, President Putin has assured India of consistent energy supplies, including oil, gas, and coal. This comes as India faces US pressure over its crude oil trade with Russia.  Beyond fossil fuels, Russia is also deepening collaboration with India in nuclear energy, transport logistics, and advanced technology sectors.

title: Home loan interest rates set to fall to historic low of 7.1% after RBI move
description: Home loan rates are poised to fall to Covid-era lows following a 25 basis point repo rate cut by the RBI. This move is expected to lower EMIs for borrowers, though banks may need to adjust deposit rates. Non-banking finance companies anticipate immediate benefits from reduced funding costs, aiding last-mile financiers and small businesses.

title: ‘Metaverse’ budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
description: Meta is reportedly slashing its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its ambitious virtual reality vision after incurring over $70 billion in losses. This move comes as the company doubles down on artificial intelligence, investing heavily in AI infrastructure and talent acquisition.

title: Driving patterns that reveal early signs of cognitive decline and memory loss
description: Your driving habits might be an early indicator of brain health, according to new research. Subtle changes like avoiding night drives or sticking to familiar routes could signal cognitive decline years before memory loss is apparent. This real-world data offers a powerful, proactive way to screen for potential issues, prompting timely medical attention and intervention.

title: NBA trade rumors: Warriors may re-sign $190M guard to help Stephen Curry
description: Golden State Warriors are reportedly considering a reunion with former star Klay Thompson, now with the Dallas Mavericks. Amidst organizational shifts in Dallas and the Warriors' ongoing search for consistent three-point shooting, a trade for Thompson is being discussed. His return could bolster Golden State's offense and recapture championship magic.

title: Aryna Sabalenka & Georgios Frangulis net worth: Earnings, endorsements, business
description: Tennis star Aryna Sabalenka and her boyfriend, Oakberry founder Georgios Frangulis, are a financially successful couple. Sabalenka boasts a net worth in the high teens of millions from her WTA career and endorsements, while Frangulis's stake in his rapidly expanding açaí company places him in the multi-million-dollar range. Their combined wealth is estimated to be in the tens of millions.

title: Candace Owens slammed for ‘running scared’ from Charlie Kirk livestream
description: Candace Owens is facing criticism for contradicting herself. She publicly offered to debate Turning Point USA (TPUSA) leadership anytime, anywhere. However, when TPUSA scheduled a livestream to address her claims, Owens pushed back on the logistics. Critics accuse her of creating drama rather than accepting the challenge she initiated. The situation has become a test of consistency for the commentator.

title: Travis Kelce’s candid comments on Taylor Swift spark fresh future speculation
description: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife’s donations: Scott cuts Amazon stake; gives millions to DEI causes
description: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.
